**What did you do?**
I deployed a TiDB cluster on Kubernetes using TiDB Operator. And then ran sysbench on TiDB, but after some time, the TiKV server got restarted.

**What did you expect to see?**
The TiKV server got panic, I'd expect to see the error logs from TiKV stdout or stderror to inspect why it panicked.

**What did you see instead?**
The TiKV logs were truncated. The last line of the logs has incomplete timestamp.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7932127/53956252-18a40880-4116-11e9-9fce-9912fa1d645d.png)

comments_data.body: Maybe we should call `fflush(stderr)` before exiting. http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/fflush.3.html
I don't know how the log library works, but I've never encountered such problems with PD or TiDB. So could you help to test and verify this? @overvenus

We don't need to change the log library, just patch the panic hook and the `fatal` macro.  @tennix 
https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/206209fbcc4c45ae50e1a66fc5df3ac39a6570f1/src/util/mod.rs#L447
https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/206209fbcc4c45ae50e1a66fc5df3ac39a6570f1/src/bin/util/setup.rs#L27
This looks straightforward. Figure out how to flush logs (both the file logger and the console logger) and do so in the panic hook and fatal macro.
